FuncDef:
The ptp permit-dmac command is used to configure the destination MAC address to be checked by the PTP port when MAC encapsulation is enabled on a port.
The undo ptp permit-dmac command is used to cancel the configuration of the destination MAC address to be checked by the PTP port when MAC encapsulation is enabled on a port.
By default, no MAC address is configured for packet check on an interface.

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates the destination MAC address of packets to be checked.
The value is in the format of H-H-H. Each H indicates one to four hexadecimal digits. 00-00-00-00-00-00 and ff-ff-ff-ff-ff-ff cannot be configured.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If this command is not configured and the destination MAC address of a PTP packet received from the interface is different from the MAC address of the local PTP interface, the PTP packet may be discarded. To allow PTP packets to be properly processed, run the ptp permit-dmac command to configure the destination MAC address as the one in the received PTP packets.
